servinfo.title: Main Bearings, Crankshaft and Cylinder Block Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Main Bearings, Crankshaft and Cylinder Block Components

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly from vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove clutch and flywheel (for M/T vehicle) or drive plate (for A/T vehicle). For clutch removal, refer to Clutch Cover, Clutch Disc and Flywheel Removal and Installation .
Using special tool (flywheel holder), remove flywheel (M/T vehicle) or drive plate (A/T vehicle).
Remove electric throttle body assembly with intake collector and intake manifold.
Remove oil pans (lower and upper) and oil pump strainer. Refer to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation .
Remove cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Covers Removal and Installation .
Remove timing chain cover. Refer to Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation .
Remove LH (No.1) bank 2nd timing chain and tensioner referring to LH (No.1) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Remove 1st timing chain and tensioner referring to 1st Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Remove RH (No.2) bank 2nd timing chain and tensioner referring to RH (No.2) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Remove cylinder heads referring to Valves and Cylinder Heads Removal and Installation .
Remove pistons and connecting rods referring to Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation .
Remove oil pump referring to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Remove oil pump chain referring to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Loosen crankcase bolts by numerical order (“1” through “17”) in figure and remove them.

attention3.ptxt: Loosen 8 mm (0.31 in.) thread diameter bolts (2) first, then loosen 10 mm (0.39 in.) thread diameter bolts (3).

s1.ptxt: Remove crankshaft from cylinder block.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Rear Oil Seal and Flywheel Inspection

item.ptxt: All parts to be installed must be perfectly clean.
Be sure to apply oil crankshaft journals, main bearings, thrust bearings, crank pins, connecting rod bearings, pistons, piston rings and cylinder bores.

Main bearings, crankcase (bearings caps), connecting rods, connecting rod bearings, connecting rod bearing caps, pistons and piston rings are in combination sets. Do not disturb combination and try to see that each part goes back to where it came from, when installing.
Clean mating surface of cylinder block and crankcase, remove oil, old sealant and dust from mating surface.

s1.ptxt: Fit main bearings (4) to cylinder block (1).
One of two halves of main bearing, has oil groove (3). Install this half with oil groove to cylinder block, and another half without oil groove to crankcase.
Make sure that two halves are painted in the same color.
Install O-ring (2) to cylinder block.
Fit thrust bearings (1) to cylinder block between No.4 and No.5 cylinders.
Face oil groove (2) sides to crank webs.
Put crankshaft to cylinder block.
Apply sealant “A” to lower crankcase mating surface area as shown in figure.
Install lower crankcase (1) to cylinder block. Apply oil to crankcase bolts before installing them. Tighten crankcase bolts gradually as follows.

s2.ptxt: Tighten crankcase bolts (10 mm (0.39 in.) thread diameter) (2) to 30 N·m (3.0 kgf-m, 22.0 lbf-ft) according to numerical order in figure.
In the same manner as Step a), tighten them to 42 N·m (4.2 kgf-m, 30.5 lbf-ft).
In the same manner as Step a), retighten by turning through 40°.
Tighten crankcase bolts (8 mm (0.31 in.) thread diameter) (3) to specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: Tighten 10 mm (0.39 in.) thread diameter bolts first (the following the order shown in figure), then tighten 8 mm (0.31 in.) thread diameter bolts.

torqueitem.t-part: Lower crankcase bolt (10 mm (0.39 in.) thread diameter)
torqueitem.t-note: Tighten 30 N·m (3.0 kgf-m,22.0 lbf-ft), 0 N·m (0 kgf-m, 0 lbf-ft), 42 N·m (4.2 kgf-m, 30.5 lbf-ft) and 40° by the specified procedure

torqueitem.t-part: Lower crankcase bolt (8 mm (0.31 in.) thread diameter)
torqueitem.t-note: 27 N·m (2.7 kgf-m,19.5 lbf-ft) by the specified procedure

attention3.ptxt: After tightening crankcase bolts, check to be sure that crankshaft rotates smoothly when turned by hand.

entry.ptxt: Long bolt (8 mm (0.31 in.) thread diameter)

s1.ptxt: Using special tools (Oil seal installer and oil seal guide), install rear oil seal (1).
Install flywheel (M/T vehicle) or drive plate (A/T vehicle). Using special tool, lock flywheel or drive plate, and tighten new flywheel bolts or new drive plate bolts to specification.
Install oil pump referring to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Install pistons and connecting rods referring to Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation .
Install oil pump strainer and oil pans referring to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation .
Install cylinder heads assembly to cylinder block referring to Valves and Cylinder Heads Removal and Installation .
Install oil pump chain referring to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Install RH (No.2) bank 2nd timing chain and tensioner referring to RH (No.2) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install 1st timing chain and tensioner referring to 1st Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install LH (No.1) bank 2nd timing chain and tensioner referring to LH (No.1) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install timing chain cover and crankshaft pulley referring to Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation .
Install cylinder head covers referring to Cylinder Head Covers Removal and Installation .

Install intake manifold, intake collector and electric throttle body assembly referring to Intake Collector and Intake Manifold Removal and Installation and Electric Throttle Body Assembly Removal and Installation .
Install clutch to flywheel (for M/T vehicle). For clutch installation, refer to Clutch Cover, Clutch Disc and Flywheel Removal and Installation .
Install engine assembly to vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
